last_episode_to_air.name: Final Final Finale
last_episode_to_air.overview: Rob hosts a group of Make A Wish Kids at the Factory, and has the whole cast help him create a magical experience for the kids, featuring an intricate "Rob Goldberg Machine."

name: Rob Dyrdek's Fantasy Factory
overview: A crew of people come up with new things to do every week. One day, they may work on a business franchise. Another day, they might go and make someone ride a bull, or shoot burritos at people.

episodes.name: Blob, Super Blob
episodes.overview: Rob begins filling his new warehouse with fun things; NBA player Lamar Odom comes in for a game of one-on-one.

episodes.name: Get With Your Power Animal
episodes.overview: DC honors the launch of Rob's 14th pro model skate shoe with a shoe-release party. Also, in hopes of finding his mystical power animal before making a difficult jump, Rob consults a spiritual shaman.

episodes.name: Extreme Timmy
episodes.overview: With help form skateboard legend Danny Way, Rob attempts to break the world record for the fastest land speed on a towed skateboard.

episodes.name: Motelier
episodes.overview: Rob has a opportunity to purchase a motel in Las Vegas.

episodes.name: Bangin' On Fools
episodes.overview: Rob helps build a music recording studio inside the factory to help Drama launch his music-producing career.

episodes.name: This Is Not Mom-Certified
episodes.overview: Rob welcomes skateboarders Terry Kennedy and Paul Rodriguez and screenwriter Nino Scalia to the factory for a meeting of the Street Dreams team. Street Dreams is the first authentic, for skateboarders, by skateboarders feature film that Rob wrote with Nino and starred in with Terry and Paul. Rob is so pumped about the film that he's flying his parents in and having a premiere screening at the Fantasy Factory. After the screening announcement, Rob and the guys get to doing what they do best: skating.

episodes.name: Shark Sugar
episodes.overview: Rob creates a new toy line of skater-kids called Wild Grinders, based on his childhood skate crew. With the toys already in high demand, Rob is inspired to create a new character called, Shark Attack. In genuine Dyrdek-style, Rob decides to promote the toy by actually getting attacked by a real shark. Equipped with an anti-shark suit and helmet, Rob convinces his nervous cousin, Drama, to accompany him to the Bahamas and explore the world of "shark attack tourism."

episodes.name: Unseen Footage Show
episodes.overview: Rob Dyrdek has just fulfilled his goal of opening his own skate park and funhouse, and with an enormous amount of square footage to play on, he extends an invitation to all of his friends to come over and have some fun with him.

episodes.name: No Mandals
episodes.overview: Rob's dream of building several legal skate spots in city parks all over Los Angeles is given a head start when a large fast-food company agrees to fund construction of the first ever "Safe Spot Skate Spot" -- a skate plaza designed by Rob, in downtown Lafayette Park. In return, Rob is asked to create some viral videos to advertise the restaurant brand. This inspires Rob to create internet-buzz by building the biggest skateboard in the world. The Mayor of Los Angeles accompanies Rob on a world record ride at the skate spot opening.

episodes.name: Cole Hernandez
episodes.overview: Rob gets a visit from Johnny Knoxville and the crew from Nitro Circus at the factory.

episodes.name: Best Of And Behind The Scenes
episodes.overview: A best of and behind the scenes look at Rob Dyrdek's Fantasy Factory.

episodes.name: Dusty Monkey
episodes.overview: The factory holds a skate contest featuring Ryan Sheckler, Paul Rodriguez Jr., and Eric Koston. Elsewhere, Ryan and Rob compete in a drag race.

episodes.name: Dirty Man-Horse
episodes.overview: Rob steps into the world of horse racing by becoming a jockey named "Bolt Speedman." Meanwhile, Drama works on his new T-shirt company.

episodes.name: Natural Born Gymkhana-er
episodes.overview: Rob attempts the new sport of Gymkhana. He creates a video entitled "Gymkhana 2.1" with professional rally driver Ken Block.

episodes.name: Trust Your Pilot, Respect Your Monkey
episodes.overview: Rob decides to invest in a line of 70's-style sidehack BMX bikes and brings internet sensation Joel Bauer in to inspire the 'Fantasy Factory' staff.

episodes.name: Local Celebrity Almost Dies!
episodes.overview: Rob and John Mayer try to class up their acts after a well-documented night on the town lands Rob in hot water with his mom.

episodes.name: Best Of, Bonus And Behind The Scenes
episodes.overview: Rob, Drama and the 'Fantasy Factory' crew looks back on their favorite moments and deleted scenes from this season of 'Fantasy Factory.

episodes.name: Parents Vacation Episode
episodes.overview: Rob joins his family in Myrtle Beach to play with wild animals for his new DC Dyrdek Collection and to torment his mom with a fart machine.

episodes.name: Lights Out
episodes.overview: Bobby Light makes a big return on stage with Travis Barker and Jeremy tries to play a prank on Rob.

episodes.name: Fantasy Factory v. The Berrics
episodes.overview: Rob challenges Steve Berra's crew to a duel of skate parks and takes a ride in an F-16 jet.

episodes.name: Making Moves
episodes.overview: Rob teaches Drama the joys of giving back and brings Ludacris and Carmelo Anthony to the 'Factory' to talk about their new body spray Make Moves.

episodes.name: Who Is Rob Dyrek?
episodes.overview: Special

episodes.name: This is a Skateboard Car
episodes.overview:
Rob teams up with professional drift racer, Vaughn Gittin Jr., to create the world's very first Skateboarding Car. Merging drift racing and skateboarding, the two pioneers of a brand new sport test their specially fabricated car at a custom built indoor car skate park.

Rob also moves his cousin, Drama, into a brand new office next to his own atop the Fantasy Factory skate plaza. Plus, Drama's choice of decor sends Rob on a mission to honor drama's unique face.

episodes.name: Live Your Brand
episodes.overview: Rob believes Drama lives a careful existence so he enlists Chad Ochocinco of the Cincinnati Bengals to help Drama live recklessly.

episodes.name: Cheese Ballers
episodes.overview: Rob wants to enter his sandwich into the Grilled Cheese Invitational; Torey Pudwill visits Factory.

episodes.name: It's Barry... Barry Bright
episodes.overview: Rob's trainer creates a new piece of training equipment; Rob creates an alter ego.

episodes.name: Fantasy Factory's Sketchiest Moments
episodes.overview: Rob and Drama recap some of the sketchiest and scariest moments of all three seasons of Fantasy Factory. Loaded with behind the scenes commentary, unseen footage, and some of the most memorable scenes from the series, this is a humorous look back at some of the best Fantasy Factory action through the eyes of its stars.

episodes.name: Operation: Save Patty
episodes.overview: Rob finds out that his mom, Patty, has fallen and shattered her ankle. Enlisting the help of his cousin Drama, he embarks on, "Operation Save Patty", a mission to travel to his home town of Kettering, Ohio and ensure that the Dyrdek household is a more comfortable environment for his injured mom. Also on Rob's agenda is disproving Patty's stubborn theory that Rob simply isn't a funny person. His desire to make her laugh brings them all the way to the Funny Bone comedy stage, in Kettering, where Rob performs stand-up comedy for the first (and probably last) time.

episodes.name: He's Just a Little Mini-Pig
episodes.overview: Rob challenges his manager Jerry to a happiness contest.

episodes.name: I'm an Awkward Enabler!
episodes.overview: Rob organizes an intervention to address his cousin Big Cat's awkwardness.

episodes.name: Best of, Bonus and Behind the Scenes
episodes.overview: Rob and Drama recall their favorite scenes from Season 3, along with some never before seen footage.

episodes.name: Hawaiian Manventure
episodes.overview: Laird Hamilton invites Rob and Drama to Kauai for some tow-in surfing. Although he has never surfed before, Rob decides it's time to up his "man level" by taking on a big wave. Joining them on their Manventure is super-athlete and legendary skateboader, Danny Way. Along the way, the guys go squid fishing, have a traditional Luau, and visit Laird's "man camp."

episodes.name: WWII...1972
episodes.overview: Rob and Drama go undercover as old men in search of inspiration for Rob's new clothing line.

episodes.name: Jingle Z
episodes.overview: Rob holds a charity event to raise money for his "Sk8 for Life" foundation, a charity designed to put skateboards into the hands of underprivileged kids. In preparation for the big day, he introduces Drama to "Skatey," the new SK8 4 Life mascot. Along the way, Rob discovers that he may be the Jay-Z of jingles, and leans on his manager, Jeremy, to get him an actual jingle deal. His charity event is well attended, including appearances by Pharrell, Travis Barker, The Game, Los Angeles Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa, Dana White, and some of the best pro-skaters in the world.

episodes.name: Welcome, Big Black
episodes.overview: In our season four premiere, Justin Bieber visits the Fantasy Factory where Rob convinces him that the only way to earn real respect is to do crazy things. Rob realizes he should take his own advice, and finds a place that will let him get chased down by a 400 pound tiger. Big Black, Rob's old friend and former roommate, visits the Fantasy Factory and moves into a temporary office in Corpo.

episodes.name: Project Man Dime
episodes.overview: When Rob discovers that Drama is planning to get a full mouth of veneers, he begins a mission to convert to his cousin into a "perfect ten in the form of a man," a full fledged "Man Dime." He enlists the help of Big Black to get Drama hair extensions, a spray tan, and a full body waxing, all in preparation for a modeling photo shoot in the factory. Rob is also invited to race professional Torc Truck driver Casey Currie.

episodes.name: The Bleeding Frogs
episodes.overview: When The Athiarchists from Eugene, OR, pull up in a mobile stage outside of the Fantasy Factory, Rob invites them into the building for an impromptu performance. Inspired by their lifestyle and music, Rob decides to form a "death metal kill pop" band called The Bleeding Frogs with Chanel, Drama, Big Black and the two traveling musicians-Aaron & Dano.

episodes.name: Dodging Devil Donkeys
episodes.overview: Rob and his crew decide to start a dodgeball team. While they are practicing, Chanel gets hit in the face by one of Big Cat's throw. When the team is warming up for another round, Rob decides to kick the ball and "accidentally" hits Chanel in the face. Chanel is then scared and wears a mask for the whole game they play in.

episodes.name: Best Of, Bonus, And Behind The Scenes
episodes.overview: Rob, Drama and the rest of the Fantasy Factory cast mark the middle of Season 4 by looking at their favorite moments so far, including Drama's legendary "man dime" journey and Rob's magical death metal transformation. They reveal never-before-seen footage from the first half of the season, unveil rare behind-the-scenes clips with the Fantasy Factory crew, and take a sneak peek at some of the greatness coming up in the second half of this Season.

episodes.name: Ginger Lion
episodes.overview: Rob gives his mom, Patty, the full Hollywood superstar treatment when he casts her in an absurd commercial for a new credit card company he has invested in. Rob's cousin, Big Cat, loses a bet and is forced to appear in the commercial dressed as a "man-cat / ginger-lion", inspiring Rob and the crew to don red wigs and explore their "inner-gingers" for a day. At the red carpet premier of her commercial, Rob surprises Patty with an incredible special guest.

episodes.name: Kid Lightning
episodes.overview: Rob jumps into the ring at a Wrestlemania event when the WWE teams up with the "Make-A-Wish Foundation" in Atlanta, Georgia. With the help of Drama, Big Black, and wrestling legend and hall of famer Rowdy Roddy Piper, Rob creates an unforgettable alter ego as "Kid Lightning". Rob wants to make his Kid Lightning debut a special moment for the kids and develops a grand entrance. Rowdy Roddy Piper and Rob deliver a memorable performance as he flies into the ring on a skateboard and gives his Make A Wish Foundation fans an unforgettable experience.

episodes.name: Joe C. And The Magic Goatee
episodes.overview: Rob and his crew head down to Shreveport, Louisiana to repair a worn down skate park, and they honor master builder Joe Ciaglia in the Mardi Gras parade.

episodes.name: Brother Bond
episodes.overview: Rob decides that Drama and Big Cat have lost their "brother bond", and with the help of Big Black, runs them through a series of bonding activities, including hug-therapy. Rob also reaches out to the Fantasy Factory crew to help create an original theme song for his new MTV show "Ridiculousness". The legendary '80s band Devo steps in to help get the job done.

episodes.name: Phoenix of Love
episodes.overview: Drama visits a professional Gazer after a going through a tough breakup, and the crew heads to Seattle where Rob attempts a massive skate trick.

episodes.name: Super Sonic Rob
episodes.overview: In the Season 5 opener, Rob sets out to become the first person to successfully kickflip a car 360 degrees in the air.

episodes.name: We're in the Burrito Game!
episodes.overview: Drama wants to start a business selling burritos. To give his marketing campaign a boost, Rob insists Drama fight a bull named Murder

episodes.name: Chunky as Charged
episodes.overview: Big Black relaunches his line of T-shirts, keeping plus-size women in mind. Later, there’s an appearance by Blobby Light, an overweight version of Rob’s alter ego.

episodes.name: You Can Never Be Too Big
episodes.overview: Big Black is asked to be the spokesperson for a male-enhancement pill.

episodes.name: Eat My Cookie
episodes.overview: The guys help Chanel prepare for her performance at the Roxy. They decide the lyrics for her new single are too provocative and write a G-rated version for her to sing.

episodes.name: Full Scale, Full-Fledged, Certified Minister
episodes.overview: Full Scale, Full-Fledged, Certified Minister - Rob becomes an ordained minister and officiates the wedding of his sister, Denise, at the Fantasy Factory. Before the nuptials, Rob bonds with his soon-to-be brother-in-law.

episodes.name: I'm Livin' It
episodes.overview: Rob writes Drama a musical about his life as a 25th birthday present. In a unique performance, Rob and the cast re-enact Drama's journey to becoming a young, reckless man-dime by shoveling horse poop and cleaning "manginas." Also, Rob and longtime pro skater friend, Steve Berra, invent their own sport and make a bet on turning Steve's old warehouse into a second Fantasy Factory.

episodes.name: Best of, Bonus and Behind the Scenes
episodes.overview: In this never before seen footage, Rob and the cast take us through some of the craziest and funniest moments captured in Season 5. From dangerous animal riding to criminally offensive gas, these are some of the best (and worst-smelling) moments from behind the scenes.

episodes.name: Thy Kingdom of Fantasy Factory
episodes.overview: The gang take part in a live-action role-playing (LARP) game by dressing up as supernatural warriors and defending the honor of the Fantasy Factory.

episodes.name: Dyrdek Day
episodes.overview: Rob hires two mediums and a ghost detector to help Chanel identify the unwanted ghost that she says has been haunting her since childhood. Also: The city of Los Angeles declares Feb. 1, 2012, "Rob Dyrdek Day."

episodes.name: Big Black's Dump Truck
episodes.overview: Rob and Big jump on the gourmet food-truck craze by creating Big Black's Dump Truck, with a menu designed to make people go to the bathroom.

episodes.name: I'm An Alien!
episodes.overview: Rob is convinced he's an alien and meets with alleged alien abductee Riley Martin, Drama and Chanel compete in the Cover Miss & Cover Boy Pageant

episodes.name: Movie Stars
episodes.overview: Rob and Big Black take a shot at becoming action movie stars, Drama gets help getting in touch with his roots.

episodes.name: Born A Lion
episodes.overview: Rob helps Big Cat live out his Born a Lion brand; the Fantasy Factory takes on Dude Perfect.

episodes.name: Butt Brothers
episodes.overview: Big Black asks for help in making his bum look good for a medical exam; Chanel trains in order to protect herself from stalkers.

episodes.name: Shoe Trees
episodes.overview: Rob and Big create an infomercial about shoe trees; Rob discovers Drama's old diary.

episodes.name: Ultimate Funcle
episodes.overview: Rob travels to Ohio to meet his newly born nephew, while there, he prepares his parents for the apocalypse.

episodes.name: Big Black's BBW Round-Up
episodes.overview: Rob and Drama help Big Black search for a woman to love; Sterling performs in a sketch comedy showcase.

episodes.name: Snack Off
episodes.overview: Big Black attempts to win the golden spork on an episode of Snack Off; Big Cat trains for the MMA.

episodes.name: Fully Uploaded
episodes.overview: Chanel is "fully uploaded" by Freddie Wong; finding the perfect driver for his new "street jet."

episodes.name: Bor Kedryd
episodes.overview: Rob tries to break a record for jumping a car backwards; Big Black gets the opportunity to make up for lost time.

episodes.name: Robert Lightfoot and Silky Black
episodes.overview: After helping Big Cat lock-in a date with an Instagram fan, Rob and Big Black become the smooth jazz duo "Robert Lightfoot and Silky Black," to help make the night perfect.

episodes.name: 600 Horsepower of American Muscle
episodes.overview: Rob invites 13 year old skateboarding phenom Jagger Eaton to the Factory to give him a shot at hosting the MTV viral clip show, Ridiculousness.

episodes.name: Strike Slinger and the Bowl Bear
episodes.overview: Rob enlists the help of a brilliant music video director to direct Chanel's new video. Then, after feeling left out of Drama and Sterling's bowling nights, Rob and Big Black challenge them to a high stakes bowl-off.

episodes.name: The Clean Hole Alliance
episodes.overview: After a minor leakage incident, Rob is inspired to create a PSA about the importance of maintaining a clean butt, and convinces the rest of the cast to help him.

episodes.name: Big Black Forest Ham and The Foot Long Kid
episodes.overview: Rob and Big Black get a hold of Subway Jared's "Subway Black Card" for 48 hours. They decide to take full advantage of the limitless card, and use it to make the streets of LA "Fit and Fresh," handing out hundreds of subs.

episodes.name: Happy Meter
episodes.overview: Rob sees a 3rd-place ostrich racing trophy in Big Cat's cage, and challenges both Drama and Big Cat to a cousin on brother on cousin Ostrich Race. The loser has to drink the entire contents of a jumbo ostrich egg.

episodes.name: Patty's Bucket List
episodes.overview: For her 70th birthday, Rob helps Patty cross some items off her bucket list, featuring a real guest appearance on her favorite soap opera: "The Bold and the Beautiful".

episodes.name: TTFL and the Old War Dog
episodes.overview: When the prestigious Petersen Automotive Museum offers to add two of Rob's world record breaking stunt cars to its collection, Rob decides he must put the "Old War Dog," (the test vehicle used to prep the stunts), down.

episodes.name: Best of, Bonus, and Behind the Scenes of Season 7
episodes.overview: Rob, Big Black and cast host this clip show filled with season highlights, behind the scenes outtakes, and bonus footage from season 7.

episodes.name: Final Final Finale
episodes.overview: Rob hosts a group of Make A Wish Kids at the Factory, and has the whole cast help him create a magical experience for the kids, featuring an intricate "Rob Goldberg Machine."
